item.title: AWS Infrastructure
item.description: AWS currently has 24 regions in its global infrastructure. A region is a physical location around the world where data centers are clustered. These data centers are grouped in Availability Zones. Each of these regions contains at least two Availability Zones. There are 77 Availability Zones. AWS is responsible of protecting this infrastructure according to the Shared Responsibility Model:

item.title: What is a VPC?
item.description: Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) allows you to provision resources, such as Amazon EC2 instances, into a virtual network. This virtual network is a logically isolated area within the AWS cloud that resembles a traditional network. Think about it as a private data center in the cloud. The VPC is highly available as it spans all of the Availability Zones in the Region where you launch it. When you create a VPC, you provide a CIDR block that specifies the range of IP addresses for the VPC.
